intro: Erigeron linearis, commonly known as slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as fields and roadsides, and it thrives in full sun. Its linear, grass-like leaves are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces small white to pale yellow flowers in the summer months. Erigeron linearis is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
